channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Aspera Faspex
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Aspera Faspex

item.title: CVE-2023-22869|2024-06-04T17:26:49.125Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.7 stores potentially sensitive information in log files that could be read by a local user. IBM X-Force ID: 244119.

item.title: CVE-2023-22868|2023-02-17T16:01:36.702Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 4.4.1 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 244117.

item.title: CVE-2023-22870|2023-09-05T00:46:14.649Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.5 transmits sensitive information in cleartext which could be obtained by an attacker using man in the middle techniques. IBM X-Force ID: 244121.

item.title: CVE-2023-27871|2023-03-21T14:29:53.076Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 4.4.2 could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive credential information for an external user, using a specially crafted SQL query. IBM X-Force ID: 249613.

item.title: CVE-2023-27279|2024-06-04T17:24:46.228Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.7 could allow a user to cause a denial of service due to missing API rate limiting. IBM X-Force ID: 248533.

item.title: CVE-2023-27873|2023-03-21T14:38:36.820Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 4.4.2 could allow a remote authenticated attacker to obtain sensitive credential information using specially crafted XML input. IBM X-Force ID: 249654.

item.title: CVE-2023-27874|2023-03-21T14:33:20.252Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 4.4.2 is vulnerable to an XML external entity injection (XXE) attack when processing XML data. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands. IBM X-Force ID: 249845.

item.title: CVE-2023-27875|2023-03-21T00:05:10.527Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.4 could allow a user to change other user's credentials due to improper access controls. IBM X-Force ID: 249847.

item.title: CVE-2023-37397|2024-06-04T17:24:39.600Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.7 could allow a local user to obtain or modify sensitive information due to improper encryption of certain data. IBM X-Force ID: 259672.

item.title: CVE-2023-37400|2024-06-04T17:24:36.694Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.7 could allow a local user to escalate their privileges due to insecure credential storage. IBM X-Force ID: 259677.

item.title: CVE-2023-37396|2024-06-04T17:24:36.284Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.7 could allow a local user to obtain sensitive information due to improper encryption of certain data. IBM X-Force ID: 259671.

item.title: CVE-2023-37411|2024-05-28T12:06:05.023Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.6 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 260139.

item.title: CVE-2023-24965|2023-09-08T20:14:46.513Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.5 does not restrict or incorrectly restricts access to a resource from an unauthorized actor. IBM X-Force ID: 246713.

item.title: CVE-2023-30995|2023-10-10T19:12:02.374Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 4.0 through 4.4.2 and 5.0 through 5.0.5 could allow a malicious actor to bypass IP whitelist restrictions using a specially crafted HTTP request. IBM X-Force ID: 254268.

item.title: CVE-2023-35906|2023-09-05T00:52:09.861Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.5 could allow a remote attacked to bypass IP restrictions due to improper access controls. IBM X-Force ID: 259649.
